issue.description: There is an assembly gap between CAAA01224611.1 and CAAA01086724.1

issue.description: There is a Mm Build 37 assembly gap between CAAA01088920.1 and CAAA01061867.1

issue.description: GeneID: 231861 (Tnrc18) is incompletely represented in the reference genome due to a gap in the assembly.
issue.resolution_text: GeneID: 231861 (Tnrc18) is now completely represented due to the closure of the gap with AC240265.3

issue.summary: the contig AC175490.2 from chr5 is completely duplicated in contig AC167247.2 on chr17
issue.description: Chr.5 component AC175490.2 may not be placed correctly.
issue.resolution_text: AC175490 has been removed as misplaced. It is redundant with chromosome 17 sequence.

issue.status_text: PCR will be performed on C57BL/6 genomic DNA at the location of the discrepancy.

issue.resolution_text: na

issue.description: Single nt in/del in the alignment of the RefSeq NM_010278.2 to genomic component AC117574.7.
issue.resolution_text: The switchpoints have been curated to use the sequence of overlapping accession AC138666.6, which does not contain this discrepancy, through the overlap.

issue.status_text: PCR will be performed on C57BL/6 genomic DNA at the location of the discrepancy.

issue.resolution_text: The switchpoints have been curated to use the sequence of clone AC140220, which matches the transcript sequence, through the region of this overlap.

issue.description: The redundant placement of Tff1 (GeneID:21784, NM_009362.1) to ref. chr.5 appears questionable; its placement on ref chr.17 seems correct.
issue.resolution_text: AC175490 has been removed as misplaced. It is redundant with chromosome 17 sequence.

issue.summary: Possible sequence error or strain difference
issue.status_text: The Reference sequence in this range has been verified. This issue will be re-visited when an SOP for the investigation of mouse variation is developed.
issue.description: Alignment of 4 mouse mRNAs for Lpcat2b to the reference assembly indicate there may be a 1 NT deletion (a "G") at the splice junction. The reference sequence at position $ of NC_0000$$.$ has been verified. Reported discrepancies at this site may reflect unrecognized variation or segmental duplication.
issue.resolution_text: na

issue.description: Transcript NM_024477.3 (GeneID: 209683 Ttc28) suggests a single nucleotide insertion in the reference.
issue.resolution_text: The switchpoints of the alignment for AC155173.4 and AC122226.3 have been curated to use the sequence of AC122226.3, which correctly represents the transcript, through the region of this overlap.

issue.summary: Possible single nucleotide error in reference component AC121125.9
issue.status_text: PCR will be performed on C57BL/6 genomic DNA at the location of this discrepancy.
issue.description: SNP analysis of the Mouse Genomes Project suggests a possible single nucleotide error in reference clone AC121125.9
issue.resolution_text: na

issue.summary: Possible single nucleotide error in reference component AC105298.21
issue.status_text: PCR will be performed on C57BL/6 genomic DNA at the location of this discrepancy.
issue.description: SNP analysis of the Mouse Genomes Project suggests a possible single nucleotide error in reference clone AC105298.21
issue.resolution_text: na

issue.summary: Possible single nucleotide error in reference component AC155173.3
issue.description: SNP analysis of the Mouse Genomes Project suggests a possible single nucleotide error in reference clone AC155173.3
issue.resolution_text: This base appears to be a point mutation in AC155173.4, so the clone will not be changed, but the switchpoints have been altered to use the sequence of AC122226.3, which agrees with other mouse strains and with transcripts aligning at this position.

issue.summary: Possible single nucleotide error in reference component AC093346.7
issue.status_text: PCR will be performed on C57BL/6 genomic DNA at the location of the discrepancy.
issue.description: SNP analysis of the Mouse Genomes Project suggests a possible single nucleotide error in reference clone AC093346.7
issue.resolution_text: na

issue.summary: Possible single nucleotide error in reference component AC120413.20
issue.description: SNP analysis of the Mouse Genomes Project suggests a possible single nucleotide error in reference clone AC120413.20
issue.resolution_text: The switchpoints have been altered to use the sequence of AC186296.2, which agrees with other mouse strains and with transcripts aligning at this position.

issue.summary: Should Mm37 unplaced contig NT_166438 be retained in future assemblies?
issue.description: Should Mm37 unplaced contig NT_166438 be retained in future assemblies?
issue.resolution_text: Contig NT_166438, consisting of AC140325.3 (RP23-403K16), will be retained as a mouse chromosome 5 unlocalized component in future assemblies.

issue.summary: Should we retain MGSCv37 chr. 5 unlocalized scaffold NT_109319.4?
issue.description: Should we retain MGSCv37 chr. 5 unlocalized scaffold NT_109319.4 in future assembly versions?
issue.resolution_text: AC133095.3 (RP23-270E19) will be retained for the time being as a chr. 5 unlocalized sequence. This clone is associated with the PRAME region.

issue.summary: Should we retain MGSCv37 chr. 5 unlocalized scaffold NT_166303.1?
issue.description: Should we retain MGSCv37 chr. 5 unlocalized scaffold NT_166303.1 in future assembly versions?
issue.resolution_text: AC147261.5 (RP24-288A1) will be retained for the time being as a chr. 5 unlocalized sequence. This clone is associated with the PRAME region.

issue.description: There is an IS10 element and one copy of the flanking target site duplication in WIBR clone AC162892.7
issue.resolution_text: PCR_C57BL6J_AC162892_1 has been created to successfully exclude the IS10 element and the duplication.

issue.status_text: RP24-164M21 and RP23-100K20 have been selected to extend into this gap.

issue.summary: Sequence from chr. 17 appears duplicated on chr. 5

issue.description: There are several discrepancies in the alignment of RefSeq NM_011741.1 (Zan) to reference component AC150682.2; these may be caused by inter-strain variation or repetitive sequence.
issue.resolution_text: These discrepancies are due to inter-strain variation. The reference sequence is supported by several C57BL/6J draft clones and whole genome shotgun pieces.
